policy_specific_is: The Institute of Social Studies (ISS) does not accept funding from the tobacco, arms, or fossil fuel industry.

policy_specific_is: New collaborations will be limited to "sustainable projects" - however, that does not exclude collaborating with fossil fuel companies.

progress: Following an occupation in December 2022, the board has been in discussion with activist groups about their ties to the fossil fuel industry.

policy_specific_is: The UM "will no longer support cooperation with parties that work against the transition." The UM "remains open to cooperation with parties that are actively working on transitioning, but are still part of the fossil fuel system, especially if no alternatives are available. In these cases, there must be a clear plan that demonstrates how the cooperation will help accelerate the transition."
notes_on_policy: MU hosted debate about APB divestment: https://www.maastrichtuniversity.nl/events/pension-versus-planet-investments-fossil-fuel-industry. research further the UM School of Business and Economics: https://www.maastrichtuniversity.nl/about-um/faculties/school-business-and-economics/business-partners       The condition for collaboration with the fossil industry in current research projects is that the research focuses on developing knowledge to accelerate the energy transition, phase out fossil fuels as soon as possible and/or avoid further CO2 emissions.
action_group_names: End Fossil Maastricht, Scientist Rebellion NL

policy_specific_is: "New cooperation agreements with the fossil industry are only entered into with those parties that show a substantial change in their working method to make the transition from fossil to alternative, renewable sources."
action_group_names: University Rebellion Twente, Scientist Rebellion NL

climate_emergency_text: has chosen to use the term ‘climate emergency’ in their communications from now on, in order to make Utrecht University's position on climate change even more explicit.
policy_specific_is: The UU "will only enter into research collaborations with fossil companies and organizations if they are intensively and demonstrably committed to accelerating the energy transition, in line with the Paris Climate Agreement. This line will be further concretized after Summer – again together with staff and students – to provide clear guidelines for research, teaching and activities of student associations."
notes_on_policy: "This line will be further concretized after Summer – again together with staff and students – to provide clear guidelines for research, teaching and activities of student associations."

progress: Fossil companies are not invited to careers fairs on campus, and the university has begun deep democracy sessions to debate continued collaboration with the fossil industry

policy_specific_is: An advisory committee will evaluate each prospective collaboration between the UvA and a fossil industry partner.
notes_on_policy: will not enter into research collaborations with Shell or similar companies for the time being.

action_group_names: University Rebellion UvA, End Fossil Occupy NL, Scientist Rebellion NL, The Decolonisation Club, Activistenpartij UvA, SRP UvA, Autonomous Student Struggle, Mokum Kraakt

progress: After an occupation by student and staff activists, UvA instituted a moratorium on further research projects with "Shell or similar companies" pending discussion.

policy_specific_is: The VU will only start new research collaborations with companies from the fossil fuel energy sector that demonstrably commit, in the short term, to the objectives of the Paris Agreement.
notes_on_policy: has decided to only enter into new research collaborations with companies from the fossil fuel energy sector that demonstrably commit, in the short term, to the objectives of the Paris Agreement.
progress: Following discussions with staff, managers and activists, the VU board decided to only work with fossil companies that "demonstrably commit, in the short term, to the objectives of the Paris Climate Agreement"
